meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your boy back with another review, and this time I'm stoked to dive into Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2. Now, I know what you're thinking - "Why is this guy always talking about old games?" Well, let me tell you, these classics are still hella fun, and this remaster does the original justice.

As most of these critics (I'm looking at you, IGN and GameSpot) agree, THPS 1 + 2 nails the nostalgic vibe while still feeling fresh and current. The levels look rad, the gameplay is smooth, and that iconic soundtrack will have you humming along in no time. And let's not forget about those satisfying combos - it's like riding a wave of fun (pun intended).

But what really sets this remaster apart is its ability to balance old-school charm with modern flair. The addition of new features, music, and options gives the game a new lease on life, making it an excellent gateway for new fans while still pleasing longtime enthusiasts.

Now, I'm not gonna lie - some critics (you know, Worth Playing) might say that there's not enough new content to keep things exciting. But let's be real, when you've got a formula that works as well as THPS does, why fix what ain't broke? The online multiplayer and challenges are a great way to add replay value without straying too far from the original spirit.

In conclusion, Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 is a slam dunk (again, pun intended). It's a love letter to the past while still feeling modern and exciting. If you're a fan of the series or just looking for some fun, retro-style gaming, this remaster is an absolute must-play. So grab your board and get ready to shred - it's time to relive the good ol' days!
